10023.description: PLEASE NOTE: WE NEED YOU TO RSVP ON OUR SITE HERE AS WELL: https://onebrick.org/node/2379328 One Brick creates a community of volunteers by offering fun opportunities for individuals to serve local nonprofits. We provide a calendar of volunteer and social events to help people get involved, have an impact, and have fun, without the requirements of long term commitments. After each volunteer event our volunteer team invites everyone to gather at a local restaurant or coffee shop where they can get to know one another in a relaxed social setting. Additionally we host regular social events for our volunteers to connect to one another and to welcome new volunteers to our community. We provide a flexible way for you to volunteer where and when you want. We will be partnering with the New York Public Library for this event. Up at the New York Public Library's Performing Arts Library, the Dance Division is celebrating its 75th anniversary on December 4 with 10 performances spread across our building. WHAT WE'LL BE DOING: We are seeking volunteers to help manage the audience and to guide them through the space, and will also need volunteers who can assist the dancers during the event. We would need the volunteers to check in by 6pm at the latest for a full walk through of the space and they would need to remain on site until 9pm. We will provide a room for their use where they can stow their belongings and rest when not on call and we will provide refreshments for them after the performance. WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW: Because of the nature of the activity, volunteers will need to feel comfortable standing and moving for 90 minutes without a break. WHERE TO MEET: We will provide additional details closer to the event. NYPL: HUMANITIES AND SOCIAL SCIENCES LIBRARY: The mission of The New York Public Library is to use its available resources in a balanced program of collecting, cataloging, and conserving books and other materials, and providing ready access directly to individual library users and to users elsewhere through cooperating libraries and library networks. The New York Public Library's responsibility is to serve as a great storehouse of knowledge at the heart of one of the world's information centers, and to function as an integral part of a fabric of information and learning that stretches across the nation and the world
10023.title: Volunteer for the New York Public Library Dance Division 75th Anniversary Performance on December 4

10023.description: CentroNYC, a non-profit organization serving the immigrant community in New York City, seeks an experienced volunteer English teacher for its 2019 Fall term, from October 1 to December 19, 2019. Classroom English teaching experience is required; this position is for an Advanced English class. Time commitment: One evening per week on Tuesday or Thursday, teaching plus the time required for lesson preparation (usually every other week.) Classes meet 6:30-9:00 p.m. near Lincoln Center in Manhattan, and teachers are asked to arrive 10 minutes early to set up. In addition, there will be one staff meeting on September 25th. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/
10023.title: Volunteer Experienced English Teachers

10023.description: Music on the Inside works with professional musicians to bring music education and hope to incarcerated individuals. We are growing from local to state facilities and also hold monthly Salons with top jazz musicians for our donors. We need creative and engaged help getting our message out more consistently and effectively through social media and our website. Talents in writing will be greatly valued.
10023.title: Social Media and Marketing

10023.description: Are you outgoing, friendly and interested in meeting people from different cultures? Are you looking to spruce up your resume with valuable volunteering experience? ... then we have the program for you! The Communication Exchange Program provides the opportunity to connect students with graduate international business students to help them practice their informal listening and speaking skills and fast-track their acclimation to New York City and American culture. CXP is ideal for people who are open minded, non-judgmental, accepting of cultural differences, interested in education and how it applies to people’s lives, and excited to learn from others. How does the program work? Each volunteer must commit to meeting with their communication exchange partner for 1 hour per week for the duration of the academic semester, attend mandatory orientation and training, and provide the program director with feedback throughout the term. Volunteers can negotiate their own schedule of when to meet and where. As a partner, you will: share your culture with an international student hone your cross-cultural skills expand your global network by meeting new people and making new friends take on a leadership role prepare for your future career by gaining valuable resume-building experience make a difference. To participate, you must: volunteer for a minimum of 1 hour per week for one semester be fluent in both written and spoken English.
10023.title: The Communication Exchange Program

10023.description: The Volunteer Resources Department administers the volunteer recruitment, screening and interviewing, orientation, training and education, placement and referral, retention and recognition processes for Lighthouse Guild. Our current corps of volunteers consists of over 800 volunteers who contribute to the success of the organization and carry on the legacy of service of the organizations’ founders. This position is ideal for a student or volunteer with strong writing skills and an interest in philanthropy, who also possesses a commitment to service. The intern will help research, identify and apply for capacity building grants to support the mission of the Volunteer Resources Department of Lighthouse Guild. At the conclusion of this internship, the student will know how volunteer programs build the capacity of an organization and have the experience of researching and writing grants. Principle duties and responsibilities: Under the direction of the Director: Through interviews and other means, gather information that will easily allow him/her to grasp the concept of a project or program for which funding is sought as defined by the person responsible for carrying it out. Acquire and maintain sound knowledge and understanding of the organization, and use that knowledge and understanding to better comprehend all projects and programs for which grants will be sought and to recommend the seeking of grants. Research grant-making organizations and analyze them to identify likely funding sources for specific projects and programs. Compile, write, and edit grant applications exhibiting strong expository writing skills and a high-level command of grammar and spelling. Review the budget of a project or program for which funding is sought and make recommendations to better present it to grant-making organizations. Develop individual grant proposals in accordance with each grant-making organization's preferences and follow exactly each grant-making organization's guidelines Keep in contact with grant-making organizations during their review of a submitted grant application in order to be able to supply additional supportive material Manage the process of supplying progress reports when required by a grant-making organization that has funded a project or program. Qualifications: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in researching, interpreting, and analyzing diverse data A proven track record in grant writing and program development, preferred but not required. Possess the ability to work collaboratively and independently to achieve stated goals.
10023.title: Grant Writing Internship

10023.description: The Volunteer Resources Department is responsible for planning, organizing and coordinating special events that bring value to the clients and programs of Lighthouse Guild. These events are often made possible by generous donation from corporations and philanthropic individuals. We need a volunteer with project management experience who can assist with all aspects of these special events, including researching and creating theme based activities, creating budgets, and using their artistic skills to create the props needed for a successful event. The ideal candidate is an individual who is comfortable managing all aspects of a special event. Principle Duties and Responsibilities: Assist the Department with all aspects of event coordination Assume leadership on day-to-day activities necessary to execute a successful event. Act as primary liaison with Department that benefits from the event. Generate donor acknowledgements, inventory donations as needed. Conduct research as needed to turn event vision into reality. Qualifications: Strong computer skills - Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook is required Ability to navigate the Internet, required. Strong communications skills, required. Self-starter who is willing to help wherever needed. Interest in project management, event planning or nonprofit philanthropy is a plus. Please submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org . Please include the hours you are available to work in your cover letter. Any questions should be directed to The Volunteer Resources Department at (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Special Events Program Assistant

10023.description: Outreach initiatives advance the use of Lighthouse Guild services through strategic, targeted contacts, collaborations, partnerships and activities with organizations and individuals in the community. A bright, enthusiastic student is needed to help with outreach activities. The responsibilities include: general administrative duties; arranging, tracking and reporting on outreach activities; advancing awareness of and increasing referrals to Lighthouse Guild services from medical and health professionals and the general public. Principle Duties and Responsibilities: Maintain and update outreach contact database, inputting information received from referrals, presentations, meetings, etc. Monitor outreach portion of website for outdated content. Monitor outreach-related referrals, to ensure that referring providers receive feedback on their patients/clients. Handle requests for Lighthouse Guild participation in health fairs and other community forums, participate in them and/or arrange for coverage by staff and/or other volunteers, as appropriate. Follow up on outreach activities to ensure that potential clients are enrolled in appropriate Lighthouse Guild services. Skills Required: Ability to maintain detailed records is necessary. Excellent interpersonal skills are necessary. Ability to research and write is necessary. Fluency in Spanish is preferred. Computer skills, including Word and Excel are necessary. An introduction to the Lighthouse Guild and orientation to outreach programs, reaching physicians, other health care and service professionals, older adults, etc. will be provided. Human services, communications or related major preferred, but will consider candidates from other fields who possess the appropriate skills and qualifications. Please submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org . Please include the hours you are available to work in your cover letter. Any questions should be directed to Cheryl A. Pemberton-Graves, Director of Volunteer Resources Department (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Outreach Assistant

10023.description: Lighthouse Guild seeks an intern to perform administrative tasks which are associated with computer, network and printing related issues on a daily basis. He/she may also be required to perform other IT related duties. Principle Duties and Responsibilities: Inventory technology across the enterprise and record information on spreadsheet. Diagnose and repair computer related issues. Diagnose simple network problems and resolve them quickly and effectively. Assist with Help Desk function as needed Provide other administrative support required for the operation of the IT Department as needed. Qualifications: Must be a self-starter and able to address the needs of the organization. Basic knowledge of the fundamentals of IT networking and Telephone Systems. Must be proficient in computer hardware and software basics. Must be proficient with Microsoft Office, especially Outlook, WORD and Excel. Must be able to lift equipment, read very small print including serial numbers A student in an academic program for an information systems technology degree preferred. Please submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org . Please include the hours you are available to work. Any questions should be directed to Cheryl A. Pemberton-Graves, Director of Volunteer Resources (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Information Technology Intern

10023.description: Information technology (IT) is responsible for the application of computers to store, retrieve, transmit and manipulate data, or information, for Lighthouse Guild. This IT internship opportunity is an ideal match for a student majoring in data analytics who is interested in working in a healthcare environment. Lighthouse Guild seeks an intern with prior exposure to data analytic software. The student will interact directly with the Chief Information Officer and his team. The candidate will gain a greater understanding of data analysis and the intersection with the healthcare industry. Principle Duties and Responsibilities: Big data ingestion Cleaning and presentation project featuring Hadoop family, Alteryx, Tableau and related software Participate with data team in building data lake architecture. Provide other assistance to the data analytics team as needed. Scope of assignment depends upon level of skill and proficiency with data tools. Qualifications: Data Analytic student with previous exposure to data analytic software Knowledge of Hadoop family, Alteryx, Tableau and related software is required or preferred or neither. Working towards a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or the like Must be a self-starter who is comfortable working on a team or independently. Exhibits an attention to detail and an ability to produce a high quality product. Must be proficient with Microsoft Office suite of products. Please submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org . Please include the hours you are available to work. Any questions should be directed to Cheryl A. Pemberton-Graves, Director of Volunteer Resources (646)874-8688.
10023.title: Data Analytics Intern

10023.description: Lighthouse Guild is looking for a highly curious and motivated Web Designer/Developer intern to be a part of our marketing team to help develop and maintain our website. Principle Duties and Responsibilities Front-end development for web and mobile. Experience in HTML5, CSS3 and Adobe Suite. Knowledge of WordPress, JavaScript, JQuery or PHP is a huge plus. Optimize website with SEO-friendly content. Assist in the design, creation, and management of marketing emails, landing pages, and other web assets. Design print and digital materials and prep existing designs for production. Ensure visual consistency of the brand across various touch points. (advertisement, banners, email campaigns, social media pages, etc.) Track Google Analytics website performance to optimize and increase engagement. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or relevant degree. Able to learn independently, with the ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment. Strong writing skills and understanding of how to write SEO-Friendly content a plus. Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and/or video editing software a plus. Creative, proactive self-starter as well as attention to detail and problem solving skills. Proficient with Mac OS. Please submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org. Please include the hours you are available to work. Any questions should be directed to The Volunteer Resources Department at (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Web Design and Development Intern

10023.description: The Adult Day Health Care Program (GuildCare, Manhattan), which provides healthcare and recreation for multicultural seniors with vision loss, multiple developmental disabilities and chronic medical conditions, is looking for an intern to support all aspects of the general operations of this Program. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Under the direction of the program director or designee the intern will: Greet clients and direct them to their daily activities. Serve as a human guide/escort within the building and on field trips when necessary. Assist with daily recreational programs as needed. Help maintain an orderly and welcoming place for clients. Assist with food service (breakfast, lunch). Provide administrative support as needed. QUALIFICATIONS: Excellent verbal communication skills, as well as customer service skills, required. Must be engaging and comfortable working with people who are visually impaired and developmentally disabled. Must be mature, reliable, and courteous, have good judgment and be professional. The ability to understand and follow instructions/directions is required. Must be organized and able to work in an environment with priority changes. Able to work independently with minimal supervision and as a member of a team. Bilingual Spanish/English preferred but not required. To express your interest in this opportunity, submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org. Please include the days and hours you are available to serve. Direct all questions to The Volunteer Resources Department at (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: GuildCare Program Intern

10023.description: The Reading Service Program connects a visually impaired person with a reading volunteer who provides assistance accessing otherwise often inaccessible written materials. This position will help implement and administer the Reading Services Program by coordinating schedules, receiving clients and volunteers and ensuring the smooth running of the program. In addition, this position will assist with matching clients and volunteers. The responsibilities will range from outreach to potential clients, identification of candidates for the program and recruiting and placing volunteers to support the program’s reading needs. This intern will also assist with the execution of the business development plan for the Reading Services Program. Principle duties and responsibilities: Answer phone calls. Receive volunteers and clients. Manage cancellations and makes appropriate notifications. Identify on call readers to fill vacancies. Escorts visually impaired clients if needed. Distributes assistive devices for reading. Manage the pairing of clients and volunteers. Fills in as reader to visually impaired client if necessary. Other administrative duties as assigned, including identifying new clients Qualifications: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Able to handle confidential information. Able to arrive on time and be ready to work. A strong customer service orientation, good interpersonal skills and math aptitude. Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel required. The ability to take and follow instruction and apply critical thinking skills. Please submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org . Please include the hours you are available to work in your cover letter. Direct all questions to Cheryl A. Pemberton-Graves, Director of Volunteer Resources and The Print Access Center (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Reading Services Intern

10023.description: This position is ideal for a student with an interest in non-profit management, human resources administration or business management, who also possesses a strong customer service orientation and communications skills who is interested in an opportunity with critical responsibilities in a busy department. The intern will help implement and administer the volunteer recruitment activities for Lighthouse Guild. At the conclusion of this internship, the student will know the essentials of recruiting, screening, placing, orienting, training and cultivating volunteers for an organization. Principle duties and responsibilities: Under the direction of the Director: Create recruiting documents. Conduct outreach efforts to get information about the organization’s volunteer opportunities to potential volunteers. Process new volunteers. Staff volunteer events. Communicate with volunteers. Assist with program creation and implementation. Conduct internet research. Support the administrative needs of the department. Qualifications: Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel required. Strong written and oral communication skills, including clear diction is required. The ability to take and follow instruction, take initiative and apply critical thinking skills is required. Prior experience where customer service skills have been used is preferred. Interest in business/public administration, marketing and taking on responsibilities that are important to the operation of the Volunteer Resources Department is necessary. Experience managing a project independently then to completion is required. The ability to exhibit excellence in the execution of your responsibilities is required. Please submit a resume and writing sample to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org. Please include the hours you are available to work in your cover letter. Direct all questions to the Volunteer Resources Department (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Project Assistant Intern

10023.description: PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Under the direction of the administrative supervisor, the program assistant will: Generate the following report of the previous days visits: Client Service list, Duplicate service reports, third party billing suspense report, etc. Check explanations of benefit (EOB) for any unpaid claims and call insurance company to identify cause for non-payment. E-mail Finance Dept with EOB and non-payment explanation for resubmission. Add new clients to the Cerner database. Add prior authorization to client’s profile if needed. Obtain authorizations from insurance companies where prior authorization is a requirement. Maintain an Excel spreadsheet with provider client list, including insurance information. Verify the insurance information for all intake clients. Help the front desk by answering phones and checking in clients at time of visit. Review and update the log of collected co-payments. Assist with other activities assigned by their supervisor. QUALIFICATIONS: Interest in healthcare administration and course work in medical billing is necessary. Excellent verbal communication skills, as well as customer service skills, required. Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel is required. Must be comfortable working with people who are visually impaired and who have other disabilities. Must be motivated to learn, energetic, and work well with others. The ability to understand and follow instructions/directions is required. To express your interest in this opportunity, submit a resume to volunteer@lighthouseguild.org. Please include the days and hours you are available to serve. Direct all questions to The Volunteer Resources Department at (646) 874-8688.
10023.title: Behavioral Health Medical Billing Intern

10023.description: Purpose Regular exercise is an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Lead a special evidence-based fall prevention exercise workshop for seniors at JASA Club 76 Senior Center to help keep them in top shape. Responsibilities Lead a group of seniors in a weekly exercise workshop Create exercise routines suitable for varied physical abilities Communicate effectively and courteously with JASA seniors and staff Skills Interest in leading seniors in exercises Familiarity with group exercise classes Knowledge of several light exercise techniques Comfortable leading a group of varying skill levels Other Available during daytime hours Maintain professional behavior at all times and adhere to JASA’s volunteer policies About JASA Founded in 1968, JASA's mission is to sustain and enrich the lives of the aging in the New York metropolitan area so that they can remain in the community with dignity and autonomy. JASA is one of New York's largest and most trusted agencies serving older adults in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens.
10023.title: Exercise Instructor - JASA Club 76 Senior Center

10603.description: We offer amazing opportunities for two day per week, or full time pro-life workers, in White Plains and New Rochelle, with initial on-site training in The Bronx, NY. You will work with experienced counselors, and alongside a nurse and ultrasound technician. Our expectation is that you are opposed to abortion, would not promote contraceptives and have great compassion and empathy for women and girls in unexpected pregnancies. EMC and staff provide clients with life-affirming pregnancy and STI testing, ultrasounds; referrals for insurance, pre-natal and OB/GYN care and long term assistance. We expect a minimum of two full intern days paid as a stipend at $25 per day. All training in advising and counseling our clients is provided for free. Applicants must be pro-life, and pro-abstinence only.
10603.title: Westchester Pro-Life Full & Part Time Paid Interns
10603.org: Expectant Mother Care, a project of The Evergreen Association, Inc.

10603.description: This is an unique and exciting >volunteer intern< position for English speaking and bi-lingual English/Spanish speaking pro-life LPNs, and RNs with registered nursing licenses in NY State. The LPN or RN will volunteer at least 6 hours per week, at work sites which would be in White Plains or in New Rochelle, NY. Perfect for new nurses seeking experience, or near or in retirement, or actively employed nurses with an extra partial day of time to serve. You can make a huge difference in the lives of mothers and babes and leave a legacy and show that you stand for a culture of Life. You will work inside of the only pro-life pregnancy centers, with ultrasounds and STI and pregnancy testing in multiple locations in Westchester County. You will assist in providing pregnancy and STI tests, and RNs (only) may learn if you choose to provide limited OB ultrasound services. All nurses can give life-affirming advice to abortion determined women and couples. The Pregnancy Centers are pro-life, pro-abstinence only; the pregnancy centers' outside supervising OB/GYN is pro-life. No abortion referrals are permitted from any EMC centers or offices, and no contraception will be offered or prescribed in the pregnancy centers. The RN will be trained in either an online course immediately or in an didactic class room course in performing ultrasounds, and will get 75 OB supervised scans overlooked by and RDMS ultra-sonographer before being give responsibility for performing ultrasounds alone. No previous OB experience is required. We seek compassionate, pro-life LPNs and RNs dedicated to making a difference in the lives of mothers and babies, who understand there are two patients, each with an equal dignity and rights.
10603.title: Volunteer LPNs and RNs for Westchester Pro-Life Clinics
10603.org: Expectant Mother Care, a project of The Evergreen Association, Inc.

10603.description: Volunteers are needed for Compeer, an award-winning program of Westchester Jewish Community Services that matches trained volunteers with individuals in mental health treatment who are in need of companionship. Compeer was founded in 1973 in Rochester, NY, and now has programs throughout the U.S. and Australia. Compeer volunteers receive support and guidance from program staff, and are invited to social events with their Compeer friends throughout the year. Volunteers commit to four or more hours per month for at least a year. Typically, volunteers and their Compeer friends go on outings to restaurants, movies, parks, libraries, museums and more. Compeer gives volunteers the opportunity to make a significant difference in the lives of people who are often isolated and lonely. For more information, please contact Laura Stein, MSW, Compeer Coordinator, at (914) 761-0600 X 208 or Lstein@wjcs.com.
10603.title: Make a Friend, Change a Life
10603.org: Compeer of Westchester Jewish Community Services

06830.description: We have an active and growing knitting club. Our amazing volunteers help students learn to knit fun and imaginative projects during the school year. We will need a few additional helpers after school. You don't need to be an expert knitter, but some experience is helpful.
06830.title: Fun with Knitting

06830.description: We are expanding the Financial Champions My Money Planning Program, which helps middle school students establish good money habits. The program will take place for ten sessions this fall and eight sessions in the spring at the Boys & Girls Club of Greenwich (BGCG). A flyer with a program description and schedule is attached. Volunteers will work with students in groups or one-on-one and lead them through various games, activities and projects that help build good money practices. Each term culminates with a showcase and money earning project. Ideally one or more Board members from both of the Financial Champions partner organizations, GUW and BGCG, will sign on to volunteer. We thought that this opportunity would offer a fun way for Board members to have a more hands on volunteer experience! Volunteers should attend a volunteer training session on 9/17 or 18 and should commit to participating in all (or most) sessions. Dates and times of the training, sessions and term end showcase are listed in the attached flyer. If any of you are interested, please let me know. Or, feel free to contact Cecile Meunier, GUW Champions Coordinator, directly, ( cmeunier@greenwichunitedway.org or 203 869 2256).
06830.title: Finance Champion Volunteer

06830.description: Support our traditional meal delivery program by volunteering to drive a route approximately 2 hours/week between 10-12 a.m. on a weekday. Deliver meals and briefly check-in on home-bound individuals in Greenwich. Support our new partnership with Filling In The Blanks to pick up weekend meal kits in Norwalk, CT and deliver them to a pre-school in Greenwich to serve children who qualify for free and reduced price lunch during the week and require additional food on the weekend. This role requires the driver have a small SUV or larger. Volunteers will be asked to deliver meal kits every other Thursday beginning in the fall.
06830.title: Volunteer Driver

06830.description: The Windrose Program of Greenwich High School enthusiastically invites you to participate in the mentorship/ career education of junior and seniors. As a working professional, your knowledge of the real world is a vital skill that will enable high school students to succeed. The Windrose Program provides various opportunities for students to ask questions about career fields and gain necessary networking skills. Help us make a difference through some of these exciting opportunities: Host resume reviews, informational and mock interviews Speak at career workshops and industry panels Our students are specifically interested in the following, though, all careers are need! Architect, Public Relations, Aviation, nursing, computers/ I.T., Police, Fireman
06830.title: Career Coaches - Windrose School

06830.description: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED FOR THIS ROLE IN: Greenwich, CT ONLY! PLACEMENT PURPOSE A Donor Ambassador is a blood drive volunteer who provides assistance to blood donors and Blood Services Collection staff at collection sites through the roles of hospitality and reception. The Donor Ambassadors cannot engage in phlebotomy or preform or assist in any medical procedure. OPEN TIME DAYS Flexible schedule and most drives are during the day and during the week (must have weekday availability) Length of typical Blood Drive Shift is 3-6 hours This does not include travel time to and from drive! One blood drive shift per month is required to remain an active volunteer in good standing. REQUIRED TRAINING Orientation to the American Red Cross Disaster Services: An Overview (Online or classroom) This class is highly recommended but not required. On the job training Volunteer receives Blood Donor Ambassador guide
06830.title: Blood Services Donor Ambassadors-Blood Drive Volunteers in Greenwich CT
06830.org: American Red Cross - Greater New York Region

06830.description: Family Centers' Early Care and Education program is seeking volunteers who can assist in the classroom with children ages 3-5 years old. Volunteer sessions are available Monday through Friday in the morning between 8:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. or in the afternoon between 2:45 p.m. - 5:45 p.m. at one of two locations in Greenwich: The Grauer Preschool (40 Arch Street) or The Gateway Preschool (2 Chapel Street). All volunteers will be supervised by licensed early childhood education teachers, and will help facilitate activities and learning experiences for children between the ages of 3 and 5 years old. Interested volunteers should have some experience working with young children, and/or experience in an early childhood setting. All volunteers are required to come in for a personal interview, complete an application and should provide a resume to the Early Education staff in order to be considered. Volunteers must meet the minimum age requirement to volunteer (18), and must submit to a background check. Family Centers' Early Childhood Education Program is accredited by the NAEYC.
06830.title: Early Care and Education Classroom Assistants

06830.description: With over 45 trained volunteer facilitators, the Den for Grieving Kids provides vital services to families in lower Fairfield County creating a safe environment for children, teens, parents and caregivers to discuss their bereavement issues. On-going supervision and instruction help the facilitators develop their capacity to be a helpful presence to the bereaved. We offer two types of facilitator positions: the nights of service facilitator and the school based group facilitator. Nights of service facilitators are asked to commit to either a Monday or Wednesday evening schedule (meeting twice a month from 6:00-9:00pm). The evening consists of a pre and post meeting between facilitators and staff to both prepare and debrief about the interaction with participants. If interested, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow to receive the 2016-2017 Den calendar. School based group facilitators commit to a weekly schedule of about one hour onsite at their assigned school, with some preparation time required outside of the school visit. Currently there are Den groups taking place in 18 schools in the greater Greenwich/Stamford area. The time for this position varies slightly from week to week so students do not consistently miss the same class. If interested, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow to see a list of current school based group locations. The Den hosts an annual training for new and returning volunteers each fall. If you are interested in becoming a facilitator, please reach out to Jennifer Flatow, to inquire about becoming a Den Facilitator and receive the 2016-2017 Den calendar.
06830.title: Den Facilitators / Den for Grieving Kids

06830.description: This position is only available to applicants 18 years of age and older. Please note: Receptionists are now needed in our Greenwich, CT office ONLY! To provide administrative support in the Greenwich and office by answering phones, greeting visitors and assisting with various administrative projects. Answering Phones Greeting visitors Assisting with administrative projects Interacting with clients both in person and on the phone Time Commitment: At least one 4 hour shift per week; more preferred. Shifts are from 9A-1P and 1P-5P Qualifications: Previous experience in a busy office setting Previous experience answering phones Basic computer knowledge (Email, Looking up information on the Internet, light word processing) Excellent telephone etiquette Ability to multi-task Length of Appointment On-going Requirements: Orientation to the American Red Cross Disaster Services: An Overview Orientation to reception duties
06830.title: Volunteer Receptionists Needed-Greenwich, CT Office!
06830.org: American Red Cross - Greater New York Region

06830.description: The Greenwich Department of Health is actively seeking to recruit both medical and non-medical public health volunteers in the community to assist during public health emergencies and related health programs. The Medical Reserve Corps program focuses on registering volunteers to staff mass dispensing clinics (e.g., dispensing antibiotics or vaccines) and to respond to threats ranging from pandemic influenza, bioterrorist attacks to severe storms such as super-storm Sandy. However, the MRC could be activated for a wide range of support services needed in the community, such as health fairs and seasonal influenza clinics
06830.title: Greenwich MRC Volunteer

06830.description: Supermarketing for Seniors is recruiting volunteer shoppers to help frail, elderly, and home bound seniors who live in Greenwich CT with their weekly grocery shopping needs. Volunteers are needed to shop once a week. Volunteers must possess a valid drivers license and a car. This program helps our senior population remain independent and living in their own homes. Your help is greatly needed and appreciated. Our shoppers will spend a minimum of 2 hours a week shopping for seniors. We are also looking for volunteers during the winter months to do light snow shoveling for seniors.
06830.title: Supermarketing for Seniors
06830.org: Jewish Family Services of Greenwich-Supermarketing for Seniors

10601.description: We need help greeting customers and requesting food donations outside of Stop and Shop, to benefit the Bread of Life food pantry. Most volunteers work 2 or more hours and work alongside at least one other volunteer. Please sign up for a shift at: https://www.givingtreeglobal.org/get-involved
10601.title: Food Drive, Stop & Shop, White Plains
10601.org: Bread of Life Food Pantry (Giving Tree Global, Inc)

10601.description: The White Plains Youth Bureau's Young MENtoring Program is a group mentoring program for boys in 7th grade through 12th grade. We are getting ready to start our 5th year. The group meets at the White Plains Youth Bureau on Tuesday nights from 6 p.m. - 7:45 p.m. From 6 p.m. - 7 p.m. we have a simple dinner together and then have some type of activity or group discussion. Shortly after 7 p.m. we head over to our gym where mentors and mentees play sports together. It's usually a group activity and they change weekly depending on what the group wants to do. We also review grades with the students and try to keep them motivated and hold them accountable for making improvements. The group goes on a variety of trips that are free to all participants. This group is a lot of fun and that makes the kids keep wanting to return! We are looking for young male mentors/role models between the ages of 19 and 40 to volunteer on Tuesday nights. We typically meet 3 Tuesdays out of the month and we follow the school schedule. We don't meet when there's no school. It ends up being roughly 23 meetings through the school year.
10601.title: Group Mentoring

10601.description: An AARP Tax-Aide Counselor provides free income tax form preparation and answers tax questions for low- and moderate-income taxpayers two or more days a week during the February to April tax filing season. You will be required to attend January training sessions on the tax code and tax software and to complete and pass the IRS take-home exam. Volunteers need to apply by early October in order to be scheduled for training. Familiarity with tax preparation software is a must for counseling, although administrative positions are available without that requirement. This is a great opportunity to help low-to-middle-income and older taxpayers in your community. To learn more about volunteering with AARP Tax-Aide check out our website: http://www.aarp.org/money/taxaide/
10601.title: AARP Tax-Aide Counselor

10601.description: One of the barriers for patients to get to treatment is transportation. The American Cancer Society is looking for volunteer drivers. The schedule is flexible and we provide training on line. Please contact us if you want to volunteer! we need you!
10601.title: Volunteer Driver
10601.org: American Cancer Society - White Plains, NY

10601.description: MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers and related volunteers in New York. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check. Please see our website for more information: www.musiclinkfoundation.org .
10601.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

10601.description: CALL 202-340-6210. HURRY! Work VIRTUAL or LOCAL. Work based on YOUR background, hobbies. Any profession, occupation. Flexible schedule . Work X hours as ordered by court. Nonprofit 501(c)3 organization. Work is Documentable and Ongoing At least some college education preferred but not required. Use Word, Excel. info@GangaLib.org Speak in English. Clearly understand spoken and written English. Use Email.
10601.title: Court Order Community Service White Plains VIRTUAL or LOCAL Nonprofit 501c3 Nobel; Winners Library

10601.description: EurAupair is looking for a local representative to work with au pairs and host families in White Plains, NY. EurAupair is one of the oldest and largest au pair organizations in the U.S.A. We are non-profit and designated by the US State Department's exchange program. Our mission is to improve understanding among people of different countries through cultural exchange across America. Location requirement:must live within 1 hour drive from the posted location Qualifications:people person and good communication skills. No previous experience needed Responsibilities:meet with the au pair every month and contact the family every month. Volunteer position; very flexible hours approximately 7 hours per month Reimbursement:$700.00/year and per family For more information, visit our website at www.euraupair.com/counselors
10601.title: Community Representative/Counselor in White Plains, NY

11221.description: Date: Wednesday, November 27, 2019 Dare2B is excited to welcome new and long-term volunteers this holiday season. Together we will prepare a gourmet meal to be distributed at Dare2B's Annual Thanksgiving celebration event. This experience will provide a memorable moment for all involved, but most importantly the homeless children we serve throughout New York City shelters. Choose one of these times: Afternoon - 2:00pm - 6:00pm Evening - 5:00pm - 9:00 pm Sign up through these links -> Afternoon - https://signup.com/go/KBrDaVu Evening - https://signup.com/go/qXHLUwo Only people who register via above link will have a confirmed spot.
11221.title: 2019 Thanksgiving Meal Preparation

11221.description: Drivers will be required to have an SUV or vehicle with a large trunk to pick up event bins from the Brooklyn OR Harlem shelter and drop it off to the storage facility in Long Island City. Volunteers will assist with loading your vehicle. Please note, a Dare2B leadership team member may be assigned to drive back with you to provide access to our storage facility and assist with storing equipment. Driver will be provided with $10 to cover the cost of gas Must register via this link ---> https://signup.com/go/cPJooWe
11221.title: Drivers - Event Equipment Drop off

11221.description: Dare2B is excited to welcome new and long-term volunteers this holiday season. Together we will prepare a gourmet meal to be distributed at Dare2B's Annual Thanksgiving celebration event. This experience will provide a memorable moment for all involved, but most importantly the homeless children we serve throughout New York City shelters. Thanksgiving Day (11/28/2019) Join us by registering for a position via one of the following links: Thanksgiving Meal Warm Up & Distribution 7am - 11am https://signup.com/go/CNGrVSA Drivers - Thanksgiving Meal Distribution 10am - 12pm https://signup.com/go/XqqVewG
11221.title: 2019 Thanksgiving Meal WarmUp/Distribution

11221.description: Want to make a difference this holiday season? Volunteer at PS 81's Holiday Show/ Family Gingerbread Making Night. Volunteers will help setting up the activity stations, helping with the fluidity of the holiday show, and help families make their very own gingerbread houses! PS 81 is a Change For Kids partner school. www.changeforkids.org As Change for Kids is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion - of thought, perspective, and demographics, among other areas - we are simultaneously committed to exposing young scholars to adults who are reflective of their communities. To that end, we encourage volunteers of color, women, minority groups, and other less-represented demographic groups.
11221.title: Volunteer at the Holiday Show and Gingerbread House Night at PS 81 with Change For Kids

11221.description: Here at AHRC, a lot of the people that we support have a love for a variety of sports but there seems to be an emphasis on wrestling. We are trying to start a sports talk/ wrestling club and we need your help to make that happen. If you are interested in sports in the slightest, or possess knowledge regarding wrestling, we would love you have you!
11221.title: Leader for wrestling/sports club needed

11221.description: Here at AHRCNYC, we support individuals within the New York City area who have intellectual and developmental disabilities, we are looking for a chess instructor who is willing to give us only one hour of their time, weekly, on a regular basis.
11221.title: Chess instructor needed!

11221.description: Lantern Community Services is a social services organization that provides services to people who are formerly homeless or have recently aged out of foster care. We do this through our supportive housing program, which is based on the latest evidence of what provides the most benefit to our clients. Our programs support our clients in the areas of health, employment, education, and life skills and are delivered inside our residences. Lantern is looking for volunteers who can give an hour each week on Monday from roughly 11am-12pm to help Chef Louise in giving Lantern residents a cooking class. This is one of the most popular activities in the building and an extra hand would ensure that all residents can partake in and enjoy learning these new cooking skills! Lantern has various locations across New York City from the Bronx, Upper and Mid Manhattan, to Brooklyn and Queens, so there's a location for everyone to serve even if this location doesn't fit your schedule!
11221.title: Help with Lantern's Cooking Class in Bed-Stuy!

11221.description: Do you care about hunger and getting people the fresh food they need? Do you want to give back to vulnerable New Yorkers? Then this is the opportunity for you! Lantern Community Services is a social services organization that provides services to people who are formerly homeless or have recently aged out of foster care. We do this through our supportive housing program, which is based on the latest evidence of what provides the most benefit to our clients. Our programs support our clients in the areas of health, employment, education, and life skills and are delivered inside our residences. Lantern is looking for volunteers who can give 1-3 hours each week on Fridays from roughly 1:30pm-3pm to help distribute an assortment of seasonal fruits, vegetables, eggs and grains sourced from local farmers as part of our Fresh Food Box program. Volunteers will help put out food and distribute it to residents. This is a great way to connect with our residents and help them live healthier lives! Lantern has various locations across New York City from the Bronx, Upper and Mid Manhattan, to Brooklyn and Queens, so there's a location for everyone to serve even if this location doesn't fit your schedule!
11221.title: Help with Lantern's Fresh Food Box Program in Bed-Stuy!

11221.description: Lantern Community Services provides innovative services to help New Yorkers who are formerly homeless or have recently aged out of foster care recreate their lives. Our programs have proven results in health, employment, education and life skills. They are delivered inside our residences and tailored to each person’s needs. We provide over 2,000 clients-many of whom live with mental illness, addiction, disability, HIV or other chronic illnesses-with the tools they need to integrate successfully into the greater community with dignity and independence. Lantern is currently looking for a volunteer to help our clients who are planning on moving out of our housing build financial skills so that they can have a successful transition. We need folks who can teach things like financial literacy, credit building, and budgeting. If you have experience in this field, we would love to hear from you! Experience working with similar populations in a plus.
11221.title: Help Lantern Residents with Financial Planning

11221.description: La programa de visitas amigables en Riseboro Community Partnership, es en un nuevo servicio que estamos empezando en el Programa de manejo de caso. Buscamos voluntarios que sean amables, paciente y quieran trabajar con las personas mayores. Estamos pidiendo que los voluntarios puedan visitar a las personas mayores al menos una vez a la semana, durante una hora. Tambien estamos pidiendo que los voluntarios se comprometan a ser parte de este programa por un periodo m?nimo de al menos 6 meses. Todos los voluntarios deben llenar una solicitud la cual yo se la har? llegar a usted. Tambien tenemos que hacer un \" criminal background check\" ya que como usted sabr? hay muchas personas mayores que han sido expuestas a situaciones dif?ciles con personas que tal vez las hayan tratado mal.
11221.title: Buscando voluntarios para pasar tiempo con nuestro ancianos
11221.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

11221.description: Riseboro Community Partnership is seeking Fun and innovative volunteers who are interested in spending one hour, one day a week with a homebound senior citizen. Our senior citizens are unable to go out into the community and are looking for a companion to laugh with, talk to, watch television with, paint or draw with and enjoy their time with! We ask that our volunteers commit to a minimum of 6 months with our seniors! This is a mutually rewarding friendship, where you're able to learn about the seniors in your neighborhoods, their art styles, interests and the changes that have occurred to the community over the years! We serve a diverse group of elderly and seek people of all backgrounds and ages (18 and up) to join us in helping them feel more connected to their communities. This Friendly Visiting Program is funded by The NYC Department for the Aging.
11221.title: Spend time with Spanish or Polish speaking seniors during the holiday season
11221.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

11221.description: Riseboro Community Partnership is seeking Fun and innovative volunteers who are interested in spending one hour, one day a week with a home bound senior citizen. Our senior citizens are unable to go out into the community and are looking for a companion to laugh with, talk to, watch television with, paint or draw with and enjoy their time with! We ask that our volunteers commit to a minimum of 6 months with our seniors! This is a mutually rewarding friendship, where you're able to learn about the seniors in your neighborhoods, their art styles, interests and the changes that have occurred to the community over the years! We serve a diverse group of elderly and seek people of all backgrounds and ages (18 and up) to join us in helping our seniors feel more connected to their communities. This Friendly Visiting Program is funded by The NYC Department for the Aging.
11221.title: Spend an hour one day per week with a isolated senior for the Summer.
11221.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

10604.description: DOROT’s Friendly Visiting Program provides a unique opportunity to help seniors in your community. Devote an hour a week to visiting an elderly Westchester resident. Volunteers provide companionship and older adults impart their wisdom. * Meet a senior based on your common interests and schedule * Choose convenient times and locations * Enrich your life as well as the life of an older adult * Receive ongoing professional support throughout the experience Volunteers are most needed for our weekly friendly visiting program, however monthly visits with a one-hour monthly phone call are also an option. A one-year commitment is required.
10604.title: Friendly Visitor with DOROT in Westchester

10604.description: DOROT's mission is to enhance the lives of older adults and bring generations together for mutual benefit. Volunteers are critical to DOROT's work. DOROT engages several thousand volunteers each year to provide seniors with support and companionship. We also utilize volunteers in our offices to help administer aspects of these programs. We are currently seeking an additional office volunteer to assist DOROT Westchester's staff with a variety of projects including organizing logistics for programs and events, data entry and phone communication with volunteers and seniors. QUALIFICATIONS: Proficient computer skills; Reliable; Accurate; Attention to detail; Self-motivated and have the ability to ask for help as needed; Problem-solver TIME AND PLACE: Once or twice a week for 3 hours minimum, Monday - Friday during business hours of 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. DOROT Westchester
10604.title: Office Volunteer in Westchester

10605.description: We are looking for a volunteer Counselor-in-Charge for Thursday mornings from 8:45am to 12:30pm, starting immediately. It is a great opportunity to interact with entrepreneurs in a positive environment. The duties include answering the phone and explaining to potential clients about our business mentoring services, scheduling appointments in an online calendar, coordinating volunteer mentors, welcoming clients and making sure the office runs smoothly. The office is in White Plains.
10605.title: Counselor-in-Charge

10605.description: Every SCORE chapter depends on the talent and time of volunteers to help entrepreneurs achieve their dreams of small business ownership. We’re currently looking for volunteers to work on specific projects. These volunteers are staffed based on their unique skills and are welcome to assist with leadership and chapter support tasks-they really are the backbone of the organization. For example, you might be able to sharpen your email marketing, networking and social media skills while helping your local business community. If you are interested in aiding a local chapter with data and analytics, pulling reports, helping with local events, or serving in other capacities that will make your local chapter more effective, let us know. Examples of chapter support roles include Community Ambassador, Partnerships & Fundraising, Media Contact for National and Local PR, Marketing, Chapter Administrator, Webmaster, and more. Learn more at www.score.org/volunteer. SCORE is a nonprofit resource partner of the U.S. Small Business Administration that helps aspiring and existing entrepreneurs succeed. Volunteering is a way for you to give back, network with business experts, and share your knowledge. Join SCORE today to make a meaningful difference in your local community.
10605.title: Chapter Support Volunteer: Use your skills to help a local nonprofit support entrepreneurs

10605.description: SCORE workshop presenters share their business acumen with their local community by leading educational workshops and seminars. As a workshop presenter, you’ll: Create and deliver presentations in your community Facilitate roundtable discussions Lead educational seminars, meetups and other networking events Track the statistics on your workshop program If you have a few hours to give per month, our SCORE clients will benefit from your expertise. Learn more at www.score.org/volunteer. SCORE is a nonprofit resource partner of the U.S. Small Business Administration established to help aspiring and existing entrepreneurs succeed. Every year, SCORE volunteers help thousands of entrepreneurs achieve their dreams of starting small businesses and achieving new levels of success. Volunteering is a way for you to give back, network with business experts, and share your knowledge. Join SCORE as a workshop presenter today to make a meaningful difference in your local economy.
10605.title: Workshop Presenter: Use your knowledge to help small business owners learn critical skills

10605.description: We are looking for a volunteer Counselor-in-Charge for Thursday mornings from 8:45am to 12:30pm, starting immediately. It is a great opportunity to interact with entrepreneurs in a positive environment. The duties include answering the phone and explaining to potential clients about our business mentoring services, scheduling appointments in an online calendar, coordinating volunteer mentors, welcoming clients and making sure the office runs smoothly. The office is in White Plains.
10605.title: Counselor-in-Charge

10605.description: A SCORE mentor is an adviser who helps individuals and small businesses reach their goals. Mentors provide free business advice and education to aspiring entrepreneurs and existing business owners. As a mentor, you’ll help clients solve problems, make businesses more efficient, and assist with developing long-term business plans. Additionally, you may discover new sources of insight and knowledge to help your own business and leadership style. Teaching others how to manage people or projects, along with illustrating ways to succeed in other aspects of business, could inspire you to continue with your own professional growth-all of this while helping your local community. The ideal mentor is empathetic, flexible, and loves connecting people to the right resources. Mentors often have significant experience within their field, excellent communication skills, and the ability to dedicate a few hours a week. Apply today if you have expertise in any business topic, including but not limited to marketing, finance and accounting, management, technology, strategy, websites, etc. SCORE is a nonprofit resource partner of the U.S. Small Business Administration that helps aspiring and existing entrepreneurs succeed. Every year, our volunteers help thousands of entrepreneurs achieve their dreams of starting small businesses and achieving new levels of success. Volunteering is a way for you to give back, network with business experts, and share your knowledge. Join SCORE today to make a meaningful difference in your local economy. Learn more at www.score.org/volunteer.
10605.title: Business Mentor: Share your knowledge with a small business owner!

07939.description: VANJHCS is looking for volunteers who are interested in an ADL Assistant assignment for various units at our Community Living Center (CLC) on the Lyons Campus. Provides companionship by interacting with Veterans per request by Nursing Staff, engages by playing games or music, assists recreation staff with implementing structured activities; and other duties as assigned. Hours Needed: Mon-Fri 9am-noon or 1pm-4pm (flexible days available to meet volunteers schedule)
07939.title: Activities of Daily Living (ADL) Assistant
07939.org: VA New Jersey Health Care System

11220.description: Looking for talented artist/designer/arts and crafts talent to lead a group of high school students to make Christmas themed arts and crafts. Upon completion, these items will donate to children/seniors in need.
11220.title: Designer/ Arts and Crafts Talent (Christmas themed)

11212.description: Mentors meet with students and engage in discussions and activities which would be conducive to the young person's development. We expect mentees to benefit in the areas of education, health, and civic engagement. The goal is to build a trusting relationship and encourage students to succeed, overcome obstacles, meet goals, and reach their greatest potential. Email jabdullah@wearebcs.org for more information or call at 718-310-1416.
11212.title: Young Men Initiative Volunteer Position at Seth Low Community Center
